result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:07 a.m.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing; 7/27/22 email inducement.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  9/9/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Warrant cancelled and returned to Clerk of Court
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
11:05 a.m.  Non-appearance by defendant for preliminary hearing.  Warrant issued on State's motion.
Nathan Heim, Public Defender.

2:35 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin L. Karl in court.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing with the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-28-22 at 10:30 a.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice given to defendant in court on 05-23-22.

2:27 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin Karl appearing in person.   Public defender needs the defendant to provide more information to them before they can determine if he qualifies.  Defendant is told the he must get that information to them immediately.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 05-23-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 03-14-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.    Initial appearance is reset to 02-14-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Initial appearance on January 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Strangulation and suffocation, on 12-16-21.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct, false imprisonment and strangulation and suffocation.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-10-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with L.L.P., DOB: 07-22-1967, or any premises that they occupy.  Defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, by the end of business day 12-20-21.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 12-17-2021
